Open the Vendor Slack and search for BO.

q: What is an NSF SKU?

A SKU that is always shipped LTL.
A SKU with free freight from supplier.

q: Golden SKU vs Component SKU — which statement is correct?
a: Golden SKUs are the marketplace SKUs; Component SKUs are the supplier-ordered SKUs.
Golden SKUs are supplier SKUs; Component SKUs are marketplace SKUs.

Golden SKUs only apply to LTL items.

q: Why do we send a JWL for an OOS Amazon order?
a: To avoid removal when there’s a same-SKU cancellation within 30 days.
To upgrade orders to expedited shipping.
To request partial shipment from supplier.

q: What’s the purpose of JWL on eBay?
a: Reduce cancellations and late shipments when an item is OOS.

q: When someone provides only a SKU and asks for order details, where do you look first?
a: NJ PO spreadsheet (Find across Workbook for the SKU) to get PO name, order #, customer and address.

q: Give an example of a shipping restriction with USAuto.
USAuto order has a PO Box. What’s the correct approach?
a: Verify in CA/MP; if a physical address exists validate in SS and update; otherwise email buyer for a physical address and cancel/refund if none.
Ask warehouse to rebox and ship UPS.

q: A WC order (not USAuto) has a PO Box and only FedEx meets EDD/cost. What’s the process?
a: Verify address in CA/MP, check DIM and NPM, contact buyer for a physical address.
Ship FedEx anyway; PO Boxes are fine.
Ask warehouse to deliver by hand.

q: Buyer later provides a physical address for that order. What’s next?
a: Validate the address in SS and proceed with labeling as usual.

q: If a customer includes both a physical address and a PO Box, what should you do?
a: Use the physical address after validation (SS/CA) and confirm if needed.
Use the PO Box to avoid residential surcharges.
Split into two shipments—one to each address.

Ask carrier to destroy the item.

q: Can we cancel an Amazon order if the item is OOS?

Yes, always allowed with no conditions.
No, Amazon orders can’t be cancelled.

Which metrics are directly impacted if an order is shipped after the Ship-By Date?
By when must orders be shipped to avoid Ship-By violations?
a: eBay / Walmart / BigCommerce: before 12:00 AM ET; Amazon: before 3:00 AM ET (12:00 AM PT)
All marketplaces: before 5:00 PM local time
Amazon: before 12:00 PM ET; others: before 3:00 PM ET
eBay only: before 11:59 PM PT; others anytime same day

q: Mixed-supplier order with a 'ship by today' deadline: one part shipped, the other not. What should you do to protect metrics?
a: Mark the unshipped part as shipped using the same tracking, then update the customer about multiple shipments.
Create a new order for the second part and ignore the original order.
Wait for the second tracking and do nothing.

q: EOD shows OOS. What are the correct actions?
a: Check cross-fulfillment; if OOS everywhere, tag OOS in SS, inform buyer, refund; if available elsewhere and NPM fits, move and highlight Yellow with note 'OOS EOD. Moved to (Supplier/WH)'.
Always cancel immediately without checking cross-fulfillment.
Move to any supplier that has stock without checking NPM.
Ship partial without informing the buyer.

q: OOS can be cross-fulfilled to the SAME warehouse but a different supplier. What’s the right process?
a: Calculate NPM; if within paid/allowance, move to the supplier with stock and highlight Yellow with 'OOS EOD. Moved to (Supplier)'.

q: OOS can only be cross-fulfilled to a DIFFERENT warehouse. What are the steps?
a: Find a supplier/WH with stock, calculate NPM; if within paid/allowance, move; highlight original sheet Yellow with 'OOS EOD. Moved to ***'.
Move and always upgrade to Express.
Keep the order in the original warehouse until restock.
